title: Configuration File
content: The configuration file is loaded and parsed by $is2boot$$. It must be located on the $isxboot$$ partition at $C/config/config.cfg$$

content.title: Syntax
content: The configuration file is made up of key-value pairs separated by an $iequals$$-sign ($C=$$). A key-value pair is terminated by
a line break or a semicolon ($C;$$).$nThe configuration file may also contain
'subcategories', denoted by a key identifier followed by a name string in quotes and an opening brace $C{$$.
This subcategory may contain more key-value pairs followed by a closing brace $C}$$.$n
Comments start with a $C#$$ at the beginning of a line, optionally with preceding whitespaces, and will cause the whole line to be ignored.

content.title: timeout
content: The number of seconds to show the menu without user interaction. If the user presses any key, this countdown will be stopped.$n
Must be a valid number.$n$n
$bDefault: $$10

content.title: hdDrivers & fsDrivers
content: Alternative paths to hard disk drivers and file system drivers on the $isxboot$$ partition.$n$n
$bDefault:$$$n/lib/disk/$n/lib/fs/

content.title: serialBaud
content: The serial port speed (baud).$n
Must be one of the standard serial port speeds supported by the computer
(See $a[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Serial_port#Settings]Wikipedia$$).$n$n
$bDefault: $$9600

content.title: Menu entry options
content: A menu entry starts with the keyword $Centry$$, followed by the name in quotes and an opening brace.
It then contains the arguments listed below and must end with a closing brace.

content.title: type
content: A string identifier of the boot procedure to use. May be anything available in the boot modules directory ($C/lib/boot/$$ by default).$n
For example, if $itype$$ is 'ubi', $is2boot$$ will attempt to load $C/lib/boot/ubi.ko$$ and start the module or show an error if the file
does not exist.$n$is2boot$$ natively supports these boot types:$L
$l$Cchain$$ - Chainloads a VBR of the partition and drive given by the $ipartition$$ and $idrive$$ arguments.$$
$l$Cbinary$$ - Loads a file given by $ifile$$ at $idestination$$. The boot loader will jump to $idestination + offset$$ in either 16,
32, or 64 bit mode (set by argument $ibits$$).$$
$l$Cmbr$$ - Similar to $ibinary$$, except that $idestination$$ and $ibits$$ are preset to $C0x7c00$$ and $C16$$, respectively.$$
$l$Cimage$$ - Loads an ELF file given by $ifile$$, sets it up according to the ELF program header and jumps to the entry point.
Must be a 32-bit executable.$$
This argument is required for every menu entry.

content.title: drive
content: Specifies which drive to use. The exact meaning of this argument depends on the boot type. Drive identifiers are made up of two parts:
an up to four letter drive type name (eg $Cahci$$), followed by a 0-based drive number. Example: $Cahci0$$ (first drive connected using AHCI).$n$n
$bDefault: $$(none/boot drive)

content.title: partition
content: Specifies which partition to use. The exact meaning of this argument depends on the boot type. Must be below 256.

content.title: destination
content: Specifies where to load a file. The exact meaning of this argument depends on the boot type. Can be in decimal or hexadecimal format.

content.title: offset
content: Specifies an entry point offset. The exact meaning of this argument depends on the boot type. Can be in decimal or hexadecimal format.

content.title: bits
content: Specifies in which mode to start the kernel file. The exact meaning of this argument depends on the boot type. Must be 16, 32 or 64.

content.title: file
content: Absolute path to the kernel file to be loaded. Usually required, depending on the boot type.$nSee $iFile path format$$ below.

content.title: File path format
content: File paths have this general format: $C/(driveType)(driveNum).(partitionNum)/(path to file)$$.$L
$l$CdriveType$$ - The drive type, for example $Cahci$$. Up to four letters long.$$
$l$CdriveNum$$ - A 0-based drive number. Must be below 255.$$
$l$CpartitionNum$$ - A 0-based partition number of the partition where the is located. Must be 255 or lower.$$
$l$Cpath to file$$ - The path to the file on the partition, for example $Cconfig/config.cfg$$.$$
$$$bExample file path:$$ $C/ahci0.0/config/config.cfg$$

content.title: Variables
content: File paths may contain variables. Variables can be accessed using [(variable name)]. The following variables are currently available:$L
$l$CDRIVETYPE$$ - The boot drive type.$$
$l$CDRIVENUM$$ - The boot drive number.$$
$l$CDRIVE$$ - The full boot drive identifier. Same as $C[DRIVETYPE][DRIVENUM]$$.$$
$l$CPART$$ - The boot partition number.$$
$l$CBDRIVE$$ - The full boot drive and partition identifier. Same as $C[DRIVE].[PART]$$.$$

content.title: Example configuration file
content: $c[gray]# Set menu timeout to 5 seconds$$$n$c[blue]timeout$$ = $c[orange]5$$$n$c[blue]entry$$ $c[#fb0]"ELF file"$$ {$n
$t$c[blue]type$$ = image$n$t$c[gray]# Load file /boot/kernel from the second partition of the boot drive$$$n$t$c[blue]file$$ = /[DRIVE].1/boot/kernel$n}$n
